Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that trees self-combusted in record Dubai heat in 2019.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the footage actually shows incidents in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia in 2017, not Dubai in 2019.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video footage is evidence of trees self-combusting due to record heat, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the fires shown in the video were likely caused by other factors such as lightning.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the video is not from Dubai in 2019, but from Kuwait and Saudi Arabia in 2017.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the situation by stating that trees were self-combusting, when the video shows only burning bushes and a palm tree.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the location and timing of the incidents shown in the video.
